title: Julie Delpy received 'a tenth' of what co-star Ethan Hawke earned on Before Sunrise
text:
Julie Delpy described first-hand experiences fighting against wage discrimination more than 20 years ago while working with Ethan Hawke on the Before trilogy.

The 49-year-old actress admitted to Variety during the Zurich Film Festival that she was paid significantly less than her co-star and had to fight for equal compensation.

'On the Before movies, the first film I think I was paid maybe a tenth of what Ethan was paid,' she recalled of the movie which was released in 1995.

Honest: Julie Delpy described first-hand experiences fighting against wage discrimination more than 20 years ago while working with Ethan Hawke on the Before trilogy; seen in September at the My Zoe premiere

The film followed a man and a woman who meet on a train and spend an enchanted day together falling in love, both knowing it is likely the last time their paths would ever cross again.

Nine years later, they encounter each other once again while in France for the 2004 film Before Sunset.

Julie recalled: 'The second movie I think I was paid half.'

Not great: The 49-year-old actress admitted to Variety during the Zurich Film Festival that she was paid significantly less than her co-star and had to fight for equal compensation

Love at first sight? The film followed a man and a woman who meet on a train and spend an enchanted day together falling in love, both knowing it is likely the last time their paths would ever cross again

By the time director Richard Linklater created the third installment in 2013, Before Midnight, Julie's efforts paid off and she was granted the same pay as Ethan in her fight against gender pay disparity.

'As a woman, you know you're paid less than a man as a writer, as a director, as an actress,' she said of her advocating efforts.

While fans have pined for another addition to the Before series, Julie's not sure their wishes will be granted as the world might not be ready 'to hear a 50-year-old woman expressing herself.'

Still strong: Nine years later, they encounter each other once again while in France for the 2004 film Before Sunset

She added: I think it’s all cute before that … It’s a very tough business, and it’s fine because I’m tough as hell, but it’s a cruel business.

'I think we’re done now ... but we went back to it every nine years. It was an interesting study of a 20-year-old falling in love, a 30-year-old falling in love again and then at early 40’s how to sustain that love. It’s really about the relationship.'

Julie has since turned her acting interests into pursuits behind the camera and directed, wrote and starred in her latest flick, My Zoe.
